meanings.definition: Cause great and continual trouble or distress to.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors were bedevilling the old man with their loud music every night.
meanings.sent2: The persistent rain bedevilling the farmers' efforts to harvest their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel bedevilling the gardener by stealing all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories of the past bedevilling her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The relentless wind bedevilling the sailors as they tried to navigate the stormy seas.
